line_1: From silence, ne'er till now I've swerv'd.
Nor in thy actions nor thy precepts swerv'd.
line_2: The Christian's dignity thou still preserv'd,

line_1: Nor ever from his steps in any danger swerved.
line_2: Yet well this little page his lord had served,

line_1: Nor ever from his steps in any danger swerved.
line_2: His watchful eye from many a snare preserved,

line_1: Their Joys entire; for then they had not swerv'd.
line_2: Their Ignorance of Evil had preserv'd

line_1: Thus, having ne'er from duty swerved,
line_2: The faith of treaties well observ'd;
